creator: george.wu@tps-software.com
text:
This is a request to add an ant task which would kill a running task by its id. 
The idea is that some servers when started will run forever when other parallel 
tasks are finished. This creates the problem that ant would be running forever 
if such a server has been running within a target and prevent ant from 
continuing on wiht other tasks. This is particularly useful if a forked Java 
task can be killed by another java task.
If there is a way to do this within the current version of ant, please let me 
know.

Thanks,


Sincerely



George Wu

creator: myles_jeffery@hotmail.com
text:
Stopping a running process is essential for any testing that is non-trivial. 
Users of application servers such as WebLogic can use the WLSTOP command, but 
there are many servers out there that have no such facility. The ability to be 
able to kill a running process launched within a <parallel> task is high 
priority in my opinion as it is a vital facility in any unit tester's toolbox

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
ant-contrib has a <forget> task which is used to kick off processes in a 
separated thread without having to use <parallel>.  It has a daemon attribute 
that should allow Ant to exit and kill the thread and subthreads.
